text: The women's 3000 metres sprint competition of the athletics events at the 1979 Pan American Games took place on 7 July at the Estadio Sixto Escobar.Full results ==Records== Prior to this competition, the existing world record was as follows: {| class="wikitable" |- |World record | |8:27.2 |College Park, Australia |August 7, 1976 |} ==Results== All times are in minutes and seconds. Since it was the first time this event was held in the Pan American Games, Jan Merrill's winning time was registered as a Pan American record. {| class="wikitable" style="margin:0.5em auto; font-size:90%;position:relative;" width=68% |- |KEY: |align=center|WR||World Record |align=center|GR||Pan American Record |} ===Final=== {| class="wikitable sortable" |- !Rank !Name !Nationality !Time !Notes |- | |Jan Merrill | |8:53.6 |GR |- | |Julie Brown | |8:59.9 | |- | |Geri Fitch | |9:35.7 | |- |4 |Carmen Garduño | |9:49.5 | |- |5 |Carmen Montañez | |10:14.8 | |- |6 |Angelita Lind | |10:30.8 | |- |7 |Norma Franco | |10:55.8 | |- |8 |Edith Rodríguez | |11:41.5 | |- | |Shauna Miller | | | |- | |Irma Hernández | | | |} ==References== Category:Athletics at the 1979 Pan American Games 1979
title: Athletics at the 1979 Pan American Games – Women's 3000 metres
